clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot Study Freeze and Transport Immune Cells
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study to Optimize and Standardize Umbilical Cord Blood Collection and the Isolation, Freezing and Transportation of Cells for Studies of Cellular Immune Responses to Immunization

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

clinical_study.source: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate and standardize umbilical cord specimen collection and laboratory procedures to evaluate cellular and serological immune responses in neonates and young infants

detailed_description.textblock: To evaluate: 1) The procedures for obtaining umbilical cord blood; 2) the methods for ensuring immune cell viability, freezing, and shipping; 3) the conditions for optimization of immune cell isolation procedures.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
For the portion of the pilot study conducted at the UCLA CVR, an umbilical cord blood sample will be obtained from approximately 8 to 12 healthy pregnant women who are delivering neonates at the Obstetrical delivery ward of Harbor- UCLA Medical Center. Informed consent will not be obtained because the blood will be obtained after delivery from a clamped umbilical cord attached to the placenta (afterbirth) that otherwise would be discarded.
Exclusion Criteria:
A cord blood sample will not be collected from women who have requested special arrangements for a cord blood registry service.

clinical_study.keyword: umbilical cord blood, vaccine, pregnant women
